website_summaries.verdict: Preferable keypad to use with a Mac as it’s compatible with operating systems. Good quality and functionality.
pros: We love this keypad’s sleek, brushed aluminum, 20- key design and included LED power indicator
A winner in our book for its easy set up and its ability to work seamlessly with both Mac and PC products
cons: Lightweight design sometimes causes keypad to shift when typing quickly

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my wireless magic keyboard for iMac. Although it looks similar in appearance from the pictures, there is a significant thickness to it as well as entirely made of plastic instead of metal. The magic keyboard is about 8mm thick, this keypad is 20mm thick. It runs on one AAA battery that is included with the keypad. I am disappointed because It doesn't match the magic keyboard at all. I am keeping it because it does work well. Bluetooth connection is flawless and setup was a breeze. It will go in a drawer until i need it. It's not something that I will leave on the desk next to the magic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bottom 10,000 reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for teachers; no problems with connectivity
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, I spend a lot of time entering numbers into my gradebook. With my mac, there's no keypad and this task is usually slow, awkward, and irritating. I felt a bit silly spending so much money on this 'unnecessary' purchase, but it has made this unpleasant task SOOO much easier. No problems getting it to connect -- I plug it in and start using it. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: L John

customer_reviews.title: Not Apple but works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: My original Pad bit the dust. As I only needed a numerical pad for limited use, I decided on this unit. I was pleasantly surprised. It looks great beside my keyboard and is, only, slightly higher on the lower end. The key placement is similar to my old unit and is easy to use. Yes, it is a bit clacky (noisy) but I am not an accountant. I like the positive feeling when I press the keys. Besides, I am not using it in the bedroom, so I am not worried about keeping my wife awake. For the money, this is a great find and I highly recommend it, unless you can afford the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: K Yake

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive keypad
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive keypad for an iMac. I use a small keyboard (no keypad) so this is something I occasionally need. Not the same feel as an Apple keyboard, but good enough to do the job. The "000" key is an interesting option I haven't had before but I can see it will be useful. I'm running MacOS High Sierra, and when you plug it in it tries to recognize the keyboard. Just choose any key when you are asked to press one - there is no key next to the left shift key on the pad. The OS will say it doesn't recognize it. Choose one of the standard keyboards (in my case, US) and then it will work.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this bluetooth keypad! It's lightweight but doesn't feel cheap or flimsy at all. The keys have a nice touch and work very well. I placed it on a silicone mat to keep it from moving around on my work surface. I was originally looking for a keyboard with a number pad on the side to use with my laptop but realized that I only needed the number pad and this one fits the bill perfectly! It takes up far less space than the whole keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Espresso Bean

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, responsive, has a CLEAR key and works with my MacBook Pro. That's pretty much all I was looking for and the iHome delivered. I use a short keyboard without a number pad, so I wanted separate Numeric Keypad for when I need to do accounts and that sort of thing. I tried one wired and one wireless keypad from APAXQ. They were cheap, but I ran into problems. Neither of them had a CLEAR or DELETE key to instantly clear the display on the calculator app. It might be my fault, but I couldn't get them to work with the stock Mac calc - had to download another app. So, the iHome is light years better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this numeric keypad because I prefer using a keypad when entering numbers into various programs on my computer. This keypad works well and linked easily with my MAC. It is much more convenient than using the keyboard numbers, and it has helped me increase speed when entering numbers into various software applications. I gave it 4 stars because I would prefer a keypad that is slightly heavier because this one has a tendency to move a bit when entering numbers rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: busyone

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Good for what I need. I just upgraded to a Mac and it didn't have the numeric keypad that I had gotten used to on my old Window's PC. I prefer the numeric keypad when I'm shopping online and such, so I got this for those times that I really feel like I can't use the standard numbers on the keyboard. It is just plug and play, so that's good. It feels a little light though, probably good for traveling, but I would prefer it to be a little heavier, I think it would feel a little more sturdy. All in all, though, for the cost and the amount that I use it, it was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Heather W

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box. Plugged it in and worked with no issues. I do not understand some of the mediocre reviews based on style and that it is not stainless steel. You could see the style before you purchased it and it costs less than $15, so be realistic with your expectations. Great product, would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Honcho

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice for a Numeric Pad for my New iMac
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Apple Magic keyboard and immediately was frustrated with the lack of a numeral keypad. I did a search for the cheapest option with the highest reviews and this was it. And for good reason, worked perfectly out of the box and compliments that silver Mac look. I'm attaching a photo of how I laid out my particular set-up (with a huge 10" x 13" mousepad) and I can't say enough how ergonomic everything is.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry B.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up and connect first try Mac kept saying hit shift key to identify keyboard but there is no shift on this pad on second time it went right in do wish it was a rechargeable unit but works well and is light weight and almost perfect match to Apple keyboard satisfied with product
customer_reviews.author: Queenbee

customer_reviews.title: InDesign keyboard-shortcut users beware.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to use custom keyboard shortcuts in Adobe InDesign with my Magic Keyboard, as I need a keypad to use the shortcuts...such as being able to format text to bold by hitting Option-Numeric 3. But this thing doesn't work in tandem with the keyboard as I expected. If I hit (keyboard) Option-(keypad) 3, it just types a 3. Disappointing, and there is no reason this shouldn't work like it should. Input is input, except with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Essbee

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, clunky design
customer_reviews.text: I tried to do my research before I decided on a touchpad. I read all the reviews and looked for one that was affordable and reliable. This is definitely not the latter. I've had it less than a month and it already shows signs of losing connections with the computer. I have to jiggle the connection half the time I plug it in so that it can connect with the computer. The numbers are large and clunky. Your fingers cannot move smoothly from one number to the next without accidentally clicking an erroneous number. I'll probably end up buying another one within the next six months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time and in excellent condition. I've had this product for a few weeks now and I've been using it quite a bit. Overall I'm pleased with the product, however unfortunately it's not perfect. It's really light and doesn't feel as sturdy as I would have liked. The delete and 000 buttons are handy, but they cause the keypad to work a little bit strangely when plugged into a mac. The buttons are a little bit displaced on some of the programs I use it with (Sibelius). Nevertheless it works well and is a decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Athanasios

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I have a compact Apple keyboard with no numeric keypad. So this product is a perfect add on. Don't need it except when you are inputing numbers. So the keyboard takes up less space, but is great when inputing numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keypad
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The keys aren't too clacky, and I like having the clear button. Before I used the Targus USB numeric keypad, and it stopped working after a while. I should've gotten the iHome in the first place. I took off a start because the feet aren't very anti-skiddish. They're a foam kind of material. I have the keypad on the, and it slides around when I type on it. I'm thinking of rigging up my own anti-skid feet or attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Winter

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Dell PC notebook
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with PC. Device immediately recognized and ready for use. Chiclet style keys provide a nice tactical feedback however they are noisy like typical mechanical keys. I would have loved backlit keys. Keypad is constructed entirely out of plastic. Brushed aluminum is the color not material.
customer_reviews.author: NJ2F

customer_reviews.title: Nice little addition and easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. I bought a numeric keypad at staples but it was slightly different. I ended up returning the one I bought and kept this one. Soo glad I did, this one is much easier to use. It’s Bluetooth so no wires or USB port that get in your way or needed for this to work. Super cute and easy to use. And it came faster than expected which was a plus. And I love that it’s it huge or clunky. I use this for my laptop so this has made my work life a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Greeky757

customer_reviews.title: Nice Addition to your Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I hated the fact that my wireless keyboard didn't have the numeric keys on the right hand side of the keyboard. This little item works great and I have it sitting right next to my keyboard. The only thing I would improve would be adding the up & down arrows to the keypad. Not a huge issue, but I do a lot of work in Excel & my fingers are use to the arrows being right below the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. White

customer_reviews.title: Easy, no batteries, simply a USB connection!
customer_reviews.text: This numeric keypad is lightweight, easy to operate and best of all no batteries to replace or bluetooth to link. Simply plug it into a USB port and you are good-to-go! In the past I have expensive numeric keyboard that constantly lost connection and was just a pain. Despite this having old technology such as a USB cord! Oh my! But it works so I'll take that simple cord anyway! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Work great on my MacBook!
customer_reviews.text: I wish this were a little heavier but it does the job. The keys could be less accentuated (maybe more like most laptops and less like an older desktop keyboard) but you can get used to them quickly and this still knocks the socks off of using the numbers at the top of my laptop keyboard when I'm entering data!
customer_reviews.author: WinterCamper

customer_reviews.title: Keys are clunky..not smooth like you'd think.
customer_reviews.text: This keypad does what it suppose to do and worked well with my mac computer..it really does have all the features you'd want in an external keypad (I've owned a number of them in the past). but I must say...and it may be petty...I really don't like the feel of the keys. they feel plastic, cheap and clunky..when I was hoping they would have the elegant smooth feel like a mac computer...but no. I would return it but unfortunately I need it and can't wait for a replacement. sad...
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: It is great quality and I use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a 10 key pad in a long time, and needed to brush up before starting a new job. This one did the trick, but has a few extra buttons and different placement of some of the "extra" keys that I didn't pay attention to when buying. It is great quality and I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Petrucci

customer_reviews.title: This one work great on my iMac computer
customer_reviews.text: I always keep my computers updated. Now on Catalina. This number pad was plug and play; needed a OS restart. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Talley

customer_reviews.title: Good pad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I would prefer a wireless that matched the Apple keyboard, but after plugging it in I found it worked flawlessly and I didn't have to put up with the problems associated with wireless devices​. Very good for the price and the keyboard is laid out perfect for those that use a number pad without looking.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Weldon

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, and for a great price! They wanted double this price for ONE in the store, so I jumped on this opportunity
customer_reviews.author: Amber Massie

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done, but Not Ideal
customer_reviews.text: This number pad is just ok. I don't love the feel of the keypad, I guess because I am used to Apple products. They keys are a little bit more "clicky" then I would like, but it does get the job done. It synced with Bluetooth easily to both my desktop and my laptop (both Macs).
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This has a "cheesy" feel to it.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it does function the way you would want it to. The feel of pressing the buttons, as well as the clicking when you press the buttons down, reminds me of the old adding machines and calculators. It feels very cheap. That being said, It works okay for my application; the zero (0) could span the first two buttons like a normal number pad. [Bottom row would be: "long" 0, . key, Enter key]
customer_reviews.author: Parker Eastman

customer_reviews.title: I expected more sleek and smart looks but it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: It works well even input to extender usb hub. I gave 3 stars because of design. I expected more sleek and smart looks but it doesn't. Also I don't like when I touch the key pads, it does not feel soft touch like Apple key board. But my budget is too low, so I am not at the position to complain. :) I keep it as long as it works.
customer_reviews.author: Misa

customer_reviews.title: didn't work on my macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: When I first plugged it in, there was a message saying it was not recognized, and to press the button to the right of the shift key, which is the letter Z. I tried that and it shut down completely. So I'm returning it. I bought it because it came up when I searched for a numeric keypad macbook pro, so I assumed it would work. Silly me. But thanks to Amazon for an easy returns system, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K. Yntema

customer_reviews.title: Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with this keypad. It doesn't have the same feel as an actual Apple keyboard, and I might get tired of it if I were using it to enter numbers all day. But I use it with the Sibelius music program, where it's just fine. (You designate note values with a numeric keypad.) One thing to note is that the keypad housing is plastic. It's also a bit longer than an Apple keyboard and the height is not the same. None of this is a problem, but you might expect an Apple clone from the photograph. Overall, however, it does exactly what I want, and it looks at home with my other Apple products.
customer_reviews.author: ChristoP

customer_reviews.title: great for laptop data entry
customer_reviews.text: When doing data entry on a laptop, using the number keys is very slow. This does exactly what I need it to do at a great price. Arrow keys would make it even better, but then it would be bigger and defeat the purpose, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: B Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Its not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Its not bad at all! it works great and gets the job done. If i were to change anything, i would add arrow features to this so i didn't have to go back to my stock keyboard or mouse each time. The keys also feel a little cheap, but only when you're going back and forth from the mac keyboard. Obviously they will feel different for the price that this is. Overall gets the job done well and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Bischof

customer_reviews.title: Yes for MacBook Pro 2013
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a separate 10-key for my windows laptop but it didn’t work on my MacBook. This does.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan W

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but came without instructions
customer_reviews.text: Keypad arrived on time but without instructions as advertised. Fortunately, the guide was on the Amazon website and I was able to set it up (with a little difficulty as instructions were were a quick guide). However, once I got it set up, it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jean & Ron

customer_reviews.title: Nerd Approved
customer_reviews.text: Do you like numbers? I do. Sometimes I like to open a nice word processing program and type number late into the night. I was in need of a new number pad because I don't like using the number with those silly symbols on top of them. So I tried this little tiger and it does the job just like I want it 2! You will never have so much fun typing in number like 43 and 457349287, wow that was fun! Not to be a Danny Downer but the cord is a little short and it was made in China. Calculator!
customer_reviews.author: Rufferdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box, just like it said on the box.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of thinking I needed a bluetooth keypad for my MacBook Pro, so I bought the "LMP Bluetooth Keypad (WKP-1314)". Once I turned it off and put it away, I could never get it to pair up to my laptop again. I round up throwing it in the trash when my iHome USB Numeric Keyboard arrived. Yes, it has a wire- but it works! That is so much more important than bluetooth will ever be. It also looks great next to my Mac, it was clearly designed to complement the design. It is just a simple keypad- and that is all I needed it to be.
customer_reviews.author: msredhd

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I will be doing data entry on my mac. I was nervous about finding a number pad that would work with my mac that was a reasonable price. After looking up a few different products and reviews, I figured this pad would work the best. After just plugging it into my USB port it worked well. The clear button didn't seem to work but that doesn't bother me. Also, the cord is a bit shorter then I would have liked, but it does reach to the Right side of the computer so it works! :)
customer_reviews.author: VJL

customer_reviews.title: I love this. As an accounting student
customer_reviews.text: I love this. As an accounting student, it's a nightmare trying to type in numbers with a MacBook that doesn't come with a numeric keypad. This plug-in keypad is super lightweight. I can carry it around in my backpack and use it whenever I need to. Also works well with the default calculator on MacBook. Each key does have a slightly hollow feel to it when you press it down. I wish it could be heavier but overall it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina

customer_reviews.title: Looks great in picture but quality is not the same as Mac keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the quality of this keypad. I am returning it because the entire thing feels cheap and the keys feel/sound like late 90's PC Keyboards. The keypad looks like it is aluminum but is actually cheap plastic. If you just need a keypad to get by, then I would recommend this one. If you want something that matches and feels like your Mac, then I would keep looking. I purchased the Satechi Aluminum Finish USB Numeric Keypad (for the same price) knowing it was going to be plastic. It feels so much more like my mac keyboard and doesn't have the clunky feeling of the Ihome.
customer_reviews.author: Probe8court

customer_reviews.title: Plug & play. For real.
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in & it works. Can't say that about a lot of computer peripherals. It isn't wireless & it doesn't quite match the contour of the Mac keyboard but if you input a lot of numbers (and most of us do at some point, especially around April 15th) this will ease your task. When you don't need it, unplug it & stow it. You can get a bluetooth keypad elsewhere on Amazon but it's about twice the price. For casual computing like I do this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Regularguy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just as intended. Great addition to my iMac. The only aesthetic negative is that it has an cord.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good but lacks arrow keys
customer_reviews.text: its ok, slightly higher than the laptop (mac air) keyboard but that is ok. Whats missing, it would have been nice to have arrow keys on the keyboard to really enable fast entry of numbers. I only realized that when I attached it to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P.

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good as any Apple product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and on time. Works just as good as any Apple product. I just got a Mackbook and was so incredibly sad that it did not come with a 10 key, I love my 10 key so when this arrived it was wonderful. Completely saved the day.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna K.

customer_reviews.title: So much easier
customer_reviews.text: I love having a numeric keyboard. It's so much easier than using the numbers on the regular keyboard. The iHome works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Number Pad for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Provides the handy number keypad in one area instead of across the whole keyboard. Convenient and easy to use. It's a wired connection though.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: The instructions for Bluetooth pairing were not clear, but ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for Bluetooth pairing were not clear, but technical support was available to help and got me going. The Mac recognizes the keypad as a keyboard, but that doesn't seem to affect its use. I wish it matched the style of my Magic Keyboard, but it looks OK.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Rockefeller

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play on my MacBook, we use these to connect to mackbooks to be used by our auditors for our beauty pageants. Works great, Makes keying figures much easier and faster than using the number keys at the top of the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: clyde F Mills

customer_reviews.title: Must have if your computer doesn't have a built in calculator.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a mac computer and it didn't have a calculator on the side--only the number row. If you work a lot with numbers a calculator is much easier than using the number row on a computer. This makes entries much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: Most dependable!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you want to worry about keeping a wireless one connected and charged when this one is so convenient and always works! Just push out of the way when not in use. I was originally going to get the bigger keyboard with the numbers when I was bummed on the bad reviews on the wireless ones but then I decided to try this one, glad I did! Would have it than a extra big keyboard anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy22771

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: love how this works with my apple computer! great for doing my grade book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful Attachment. Bought for laptop.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally bought one. Much easier to use than typing on keyborad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: And that’s what I paid for it. It feels as good as the price. Does what it should do. But I won’t expect it to last as long as my 2009 MBP has.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Mine arrived defective - won't turn on even with new batteries of my own
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived defective; waiting on message from store about returning - it seems they expect me to pay return shipping on a defective product. Not going to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect keypad
customer_reviews.text: Works great on mac and pc, the keys feel good, they make a bit too much noise when hit... to me the downside goes as follow: first, the "on" light really mismatch the feel of the computer which doesn`t have a "on" light at all, and second: I loose one usb port and when you take a look at the back side you see that it has two slots for usb, but no usb ports, I guess they left out that option on mine... other than that, this keypad is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph Glen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Matches Mac computers perfectly! Great quality for the price, they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use!
customer_reviews.text: My aunt has a macbook air, yet she was doing all of her book keeping in paper notebooks and with calculators. She runs a business so there is a a lot of number crunching. I bought her this in the hopes of helping her to transition over to her computer. She is not very tech savvy, but it was so easy to set up that she managed to do it herself! She loved it so much she finally made the transition over. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mae

customer_reviews.title: Keys are a little stiff, but the product works
customer_reviews.text: The keys are a little stiff and do not type as naturally as the apple keyboard. It works and inputs numbers perfectly, but I wish the keys responded differently.
customer_reviews.author: JCRILEY

customer_reviews.title: I like this USB version and I am keeping it if ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm running Bootcamp on my Mac and the bluetooth 10 key the office gave me didn't connect to the Windows side for whatever reason. It used to connect, but I'm guessing an update happened and now it doesn't. I like this USB version and I am keeping it if I leave the company because Accounting.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but wished it was nicer
customer_reviews.text: Works well does not really look as close to the Apple keyboard as I had hoped and does not have the same slant sitting next to the Apple keyboard. Feels cheap and is not aluminum faced...I had hoped for better
customer_reviews.author: Jlwdfw

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Material quality feels cheap and much lower than the rest of Apple products I have.
customer_reviews.author: C Erd

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not compatible with my Mac.. when I plugged it in my mouse stopped working. Don’t waste your money and get the real apple keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for numbers, but don't expect second key functions.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad if you don't want the Home/End/PgUp/PgDown functions. That button up top is not a function lock, but a "clear" key which seems to behave entirely like the upper right delete key. Looks decent on the desktop next to the Bluetooth wireless keyboard, but it won't be mistaken for being the same maker. Decent speed and keypress depth.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Started working from home due to COVID with a data entry job, so I use a keypad more than a keyboard. I used this with my MacBook Pro and it worked great. It’s not as fluid as the keyboard I am used to, but it doesn’t hinder the use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Cannon

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 10 key to use with my Macbook pro retina. I thought this would work well, especially for the price. It does work, but it's really cheap. The keys are a hard crunchy plastic, and the 10 key is kind of big and clunky overall. For the price, it's worth it, but I only use it when I REALLY have to.
customer_reviews.author: Rach L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to do our books. Entering in time sheets and expenses is time consuming when you have to use the numbers at the top of the keyboard. Easy hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy S.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a couple of changes to be great. Still good.
customer_reviews.text: The 10 key works really well for what I needed. My only qualms are that there is a 000 key. It would make more sense if there were a 00 key instead of a 000 key at lease for what I use the 10 key for. My only other issue is that I wish there was a tab key on this 10 key for data entry on forms. Other than that it does what it is supposed to do and the price wasn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rorosdad

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no installation hassle
customer_reviews.text: This works well. It looks a little dated (not as sleek as some new computer accessories) but is functional and definitely worth it for the price. I just plugged it in and it worked right away, no difficult installation. I am happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisak

customer_reviews.title: Matches my iMac and works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my iMac. My keyboard doesn't have a ten-key section so this little device plugged right in and saved the day. I keep it plugged in all the time. It matches the aluminum case on my iMac too so it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very responsive
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, works right away. Great feel to the keys
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good Number Pad for Use with MacBook
customer_reviews.text: As much as I love my MacBook Pro, there are just some times you need a number pad! This is a plug-and-play number pad that works perfectly. The cord could be a little longer - six more inches would be perfect, but it's not too short for normal use. I've just gotten used to wireless accessories and having a lot more flexibility of where I can use them.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Janicki

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my Macbook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my laptop because I started to work from home once a week. I absolutely love it and don't know what I'd do without it. The only downfall is that my Macbook's USB slots are on the left side, but I'm so used to using the keypad on the right side. The cord reaches so it's not that big of a deal, it's just a little annoying. I'd love to see it go wireless!
customer_reviews.author: shley

customer_reviews.title: Great for a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keypad because I have a MacBook laptop - the keyboard does not have a numeric keypad. I'm so glad I got this item. The cord is long enough to stretch around to the USB port side of the laptop, it has "feet" on the bottom to eliminate skidding, and the keys are big and easy to use. I recommend this item highly.
customer_reviews.author: a New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Im very happy with the keypad
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with the keypad. I moved from a PC with a numeric keypad to a MacBook without one. I do much number entries so I gave this product a try. It works very well and installed instantly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PCD

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product and it works as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and it works as described. I recommend that the manufacturer add some length to the cord and maybe improve the keypad to be less noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Helmy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable number pad
customer_reviews.text: This will also work with PCs I found out as I have recently switched from a Mac to a PC. I have had it for a year and a half and it has spent sometime getting abused in the bottom of my backpack, but still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A.

customer_reviews.title: has a nice thick feel and makes entering numbers much nicer and ...
customer_reviews.text: has a nice thick feel and makes entering numbers much nicer and quicker but I do wish it had the up and down arrow options.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard works great and pairing it was so easy
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any pairing issues whatsoever. This keyboard works great and pairing it was so easy!! It saves me so much time because I have to type up invoices on my mac laptop and using the numbers on the mac keyboard takes so much time! I love the fact that it has the "00", which is a great added feature. This keyboard has been a lifesaver for me. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for an easier way to input numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: This was great at first
customer_reviews.text: This was great at first. Synced up with my computer just fine. However, a month later when I went to use it again it was completely useless. I couldn't get it to work no matter what I tried and the date for returns had already passed. Very unhappy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica N.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. I only need to use this ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I only need to use this once a week and it does it's job. I didn't want to spend twice as much for a bluetooth version where I'd have to charge. This USB numeric keypad is what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Misopanda

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my macbook air.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing negative to say about this except that it is a little loud. I worry I annoy my office mates with the loud clicking sometimes but I don't usually have to use the number pad for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: marathoners

customer_reviews.title: Plastic, what did you think,  I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I worked perfectly, plug and play. Yes it is plastic but what did you expect, really, it does not even look like aluminum and if it were it would probably be $40 dollars more. It was plug and play with my Mac book pro. I love it, it is so much easier to 10 key over using the top row of keys on a lap top.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Such a big help!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a big help to have! Our new mac keyboard doesnt have the number keypad and I am lost without it! My only concern is how much higher then the mac slim keyboard it, but all in all a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: CookingwithChristine

customer_reviews.title: Good numeric pad for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this numeric pad for my MacBook Pro 2013. While the keys do not feel as sophisticated as those of the laptop, I do not find it bothersome at all as mentioned by some reviewers. In additon this should not be expected given such a low price. The unit works and looks as described and was functional the moment I connected it to the laptop. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: deutom

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The usb plug in is a little goofy but it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This keypad works great with our iMac. My only complaint is the placement of the 000 key, it is where the 0 key is normally on a keypad, so I often hit the 000 instead of 0. I'm sure that over time I will get used to this, but it's slightly annoying until then. In defense of the seller, this is visible in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: EJCRDan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Every month I have a report to do for work that is heavy on data entry and I don't have a 10 key on my laptop. (Apparently Apple does not make a MacBook Pro with a 10-key) This was a great solution. Works well, fair price. Matches my MacBook. I just pugged it in and it worked! Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry0219

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Push the buttons, stuff happens... Lightweight, but the no-slip pads on the bottom keep it from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli V.

customer_reviews.title: New or used?
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered without a quick start guide. Can't answer any of the questions since I need to find a downloadable instruction set before I can access the performance of this product
customer_reviews.author: Desert poppy

customer_reviews.title: Makes entering grades on my MacBook Pro SO much easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes entering grades on my MacBook Pro SO much easier. At first I got a message that it wasn't going to work with the MacBook, but it does. Not sure why that message popped up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keypad.
customer_reviews.text: I have a mac. This keypad is the fourth I have gotten of various brands. The rest broke pretty quickly. They were not up to the challenge of bulk data entry. It is not the cheapest, but it sure is great for bulk data entry. I am a scientist and I type a lot, and quickly, and this is the keypad for it. The numbers are easy to press, pretty sensitive, the keypad is comfortable, and it plugs in and is good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude

customer_reviews.title: This iHome USB Numeric Keypad is the perfect companion to my MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: As Chair of the Finance Committee for my Church, a 10-key pad is an absolute necessity for the work I do in performance of my role. This iHome USB Numeric Keypad is the perfect companion to my MacBook Air! There were no drivers to install, simply "Plug 'n Play". I have two other iHome products, the bedside alarm, where I dock my iPhone to charge at night and the travel speaker system/alarm. I am never disappointed in iHome products. You will not be either.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for Math Drills at Home
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very helpful addition to cd-rom math lessons. It is sturdy and responds well with our 10 year mac laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually much easier to use than my old keypad on my old keyboard. I use it with my MacAirbook. Totally portable. Perfect. I don't always need a keypad, so I don't HAVE to take it with.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Works great for MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it. She does a lot of data entry all day and this has been working great with her MacBook Air.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Osborne

customer_reviews.title: You need one
customer_reviews.text: I’m a teacher and it makes inputting grades 100 times faster.
customer_reviews.author: R Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love the IHome Numeric Keypad
customer_reviews.text: I love having this option for my computer!! It is very simple and does the job. Just plug it in and get going! For anyone use to using a 10 key pad, it is a must for quicker and more accurate calculations. I highly recommend it, though I have only had it a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: K. Leadman

customer_reviews.title: Keys are not as nice as those on my mac
customer_reviews.text: Keys are not as nice as those on my mac. If you need this for massive data entry, you may want a more upscale model from another manufacturer. Otherwise this works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: I use it about 4 hours a week for data entry and it's great.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, and haven't had any problems with it. I use it about 4 hours a week for data entry and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: tacs12

customer_reviews.title: Noisy keys
customer_reviews.text: It works as it should, but the keys are noisier than I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.author: S. GAFFNEY

product_meta.title: iHome Wired USB Numeric Keypad for Apple Mac iMac MacBook Pro/Air Laptops and Desktop Computers, Slim Compact and Portable, Wide 20 Key Numerical Numpad, Silver
product_meta.description: Color:WiredImprove the speed and accuracy of data input with this wired, plug-and-play numeric keypad — just connect the USB cable to your Mac laptop or desktop computer and you're ready to get to work at home or at the office. No software or batteries required. Perfect for finance professionals, accountants, students, teachers, and administrators using spreadsheets and financial management tools, this numeric keypad is also a great for programmers and digital creators using video and music production software. Offering a low-profile design for quiet typing, optimized key travel, and accurate keystroke transfer, it includes quick-press Clear, Delete, and 000 shortcut keys to save you time when inputting numbers. This sleek, stylish, and compact keypad with responsive, full-sized white keys and metallic silver body complements today's modern Apple and PC designs, and it takes up minimal space on your desktop. It requires a USB-A port and works with Mac laptops and computers (OS X/macOS 10.4 or later). From power accessories for smartphones and tablets, to a variety of mouse and keyboard/keypad options for both laptops and desktops, iHome helps you unlock the full potential of your devices both at home and on the go.
feature_bullets: Improve the speed and accuracy of data input with this wired, plug-and-play numeric keypad — just connect the USB cable to your Mac laptop or desktop computer and you're ready to get to work at home or at the office. No software or batteries required.

Perfect for finance professionals, accountants, students, teachers, and administrators using spreadsheets and financial management tools, this numeric keypad is also a great for programmers and digital creators using video and music production software.

Offering a low-profile design for quiet typing, optimized key travel, and accurate keystroke transfer, it includes quick-press Clear, Delete, and 000 shortcut keys to save you time when inputting numbers.
This sleek, stylish, and compact keypad with responsive, full-sized white keys and metallic silver body complements today's modern Apple and PC designs, and it takes up minimal space on your desktop.
Requires a USB-A port and works with Mac laptops and computers (OS X/macOS 10.4 or later).
